docs.snippet: An irregular trend was evident in the foreign exchange market during the last week. Amount of business transacted in the pound sterling picked up considerably over previous weeks and the Canadian dollar was moderately active.
docs.lead_paragraph: An irregular trend was evident in the foreign exchange market during the last week. Amount of business transacted in the pound sterling picked up considerably over previous weeks and the Canadian dollar was moderately active.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended July 17, 1953

docs.snippet: Brazil's outstanding draft indebtedness to United States exporters fall $21,000,000 in June, reducing the debt to $175,700,000, a thirteen-month low, the Federal Reserve Bank here said yesterday. The figures represent debt to exporters whose...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's outstanding draft indebtedness to United States exporters fall $21,000,000 in June, reducing the debt to $175,700,000, a thirteen-month low, the Federal Reserve Bank here said yesterday. The figures represent debt to exporters whose financing is reported by the fifteen banks participating in the Reserve Bank's monthly survey of Latin American export credit conditions.
docs.abstract: draft debt to US cut $21 million, June; $30.2 million paid

headline.main: BRAZIL DRAFT DEBT IS CUT $21,000,000; June Payments Nearly Double May's, to Set 13-Month Low for Balance on Backlog

docs.snippet: A steady tone that prevailed in the foreign exchange market during the past week caused rates to be confined to a limited movement. Dealings were reported to be only moderate in size and mostly routine.

docs.snippet: A quiet steady undertone prevailed throughout the foreign exchange market during the past week. Activity in the pound sterling slackened off considerably while business in the Canadian dollar picked up in volume. The signing of the Korean truce, long...
docs.lead_paragraph: A quiet steady undertone prevailed throughout the foreign exchange market during the past week. Activity in the pound sterling slackened off considerably while business in the Canadian dollar picked up in volume. The signing of the Korean truce, long expected, had no material effect on the market.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 -- An Israeli Embassy spokesman said today the establishment of his Government's Foreign Office in Jerusalem was merely a move toward restoring the status of May, 1950, when Jerusalem was functioning as the capital of Israel.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5 -- An Israeli Embassy spokesman said today the establishment of his Government's Foreign Office in Jerusalem was merely a move toward restoring the status of May, 1950, when Jerusalem was functioning as the capital of Israel.
docs.abstract: holds Arabs oppose every plan to safeguard Holy Places

headline.main: ISRAELI DEFENDS SHIFT OF CAPITAL; Embassy Aide Says Jerusalem Move Restores 1950 Status -- U. S. Role Is Cited

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Thursday, Aug. 6 -- While ships searched expanses of the North Atlantic last night directed by planes circling above the wreckage of a United States Air Force RB-36 bomber that crashed in the sea before dawn, sixteen members of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Thursday, Aug. 6 -- While ships searched expanses of the North Atlantic last night directed by planes circling above the wreckage of a United States Air Force RB-36 bomber that crashed in the sea before dawn, sixteen members of the twenty-three-man crew were still missing.
docs.abstract: 4 saved, 3 bodies recovered, 16 still missing; men were bound for 30-day temporary duty, Eng; identified; map; 4 crewmen illus

headline.main: 4 From Ditched Plane Safe; 16 Still Missing in Atlantic; 4 FLIERS RESCUED; SEARCH CONTINUES
